1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Picker is a data for picking target elements
4--   based on element names.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Base.List.Picker
7  ( picker,
8    Picker (..),
9  ) where
10
11import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture              as O
12import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.List.Select      as B
13
14-- | Create picker.
15picker :: (Ord n) => [n] -> [n] -> Picker n c
16picker ls rs = pk where
17    -- index
18    (li, ri)   = B.selectIndexBoth ls rs
19
20    -- map
21    properL    = B.selectOthers    li
22    shareL     = B.selectElems     li
23    shareR     = B.selectElems     ri
24    properR    = B.selectOthers    ri
25
26    -- split
27    splitR xs  = (shareR xs, properR xs)
28    assocR xs  = (shareR xs, xs)
29
30    pk = Picker
31         { pkDisjoint       = null li
32
33         -- index
34         , pkLShareIndex    = li
35         , pkRShareIndex    = ri
36
37         -- name
38         , pkLProperNames   = properL ls
39         , pkLShareNames    = shareL  ls
40         , pkRShareNames    = shareR  rs
41         , pkRProperNames   = properR rs
42
43         -- map
44         , pkLProper        = properL
45         , pkLShare         = shareL
46         , pkRShare         = shareR
47         , pkRProper        = properR
48         , pkRForward       = B.permuteForward  ri
49         , pkRBackward      = B.permuteBackward ri
50
51         -- split
52         , pkRSplit         = splitR
53         , pkRAssoc         = assocR
54         }
55
56-- | Picker data.
57--
58--   For example, __\/a \/b \/c__ and __\/b \/c \/d \/e__
59--   have left-proper terms __\/a__,
60--   shared terms __\/b \/c__,
61--   and right-proper terms __\/d \/e__.
62--
63--   >>> let pk = picker (words "/a /b /c") (words "/b /c /d /e")
64--
65data Picker n c = Picker
66    { pkDisjoint :: Bool
67      -- ^ __Test:__ Whether shared part is empty
68      --
69      --   >>> pkDisjoint pk
70      --   False
71      --
72      --   >>> pkDisjoint $ picker (words "/a /b /c") (words "/d /e")
73      --   True
74
75    , pkLShareIndex :: [Int]
76      -- ^ __Index:__ Indicies of right-shared part
77      --
78      --   >>> pkLShareIndex pk
79      --   [1, 2]
80
81    , pkRShareIndex :: [Int]
82      -- ^ __Index:__ Indicies of left-shared part
83      --
84      --   >>> pkRShareIndex pk
85      --   [0, 1]
86
87    , pkLProperNames :: [n]
88      -- ^ __Name:__ Left-proper term names
89      --
90      --   >>> pkLProperNames pk
91      --   ["/a"]
92
93    , pkLShareNames :: [n]
94      -- ^ __Name:__ Left-shared term names
95      --
96      --   >>> pkLShareNames pk
97      --   ["/b","/c"]
98
99    , pkRProperNames :: [n]
100      -- ^ __Name:__ Right-proper term names
101      --
102      --   >>> pkRProperNames pk
103      --   ["/d","/e"]
104
105    , pkRShareNames :: [n]
106      -- ^ __Name:__ Right-shared term names
107      --
108      --   >>> pkRShareNames pk
109      --   ["/b","/c"]
110
111    , pkLProper :: O.Map [c]
112      -- ^ __Map:__ Pick left-proper part from left contents
113      --
114      --   >>> pkLProper pk "ABC"
115      --   "A"
116
117    , pkLShare :: O.Map [c]
118      -- ^ __Map:__ Pick left-shared part from left contents
119      --
120      --   >>> pkLShare pk "ABC"
121      --   "BC"
122
123    , pkRShare :: O.Map [c]
124      -- ^ __Map:__ Pick right-shared part from right contents
125      --
126      --   >>> pkRShare pk "BCDE"
127      --   "BC"
128
129    , pkRProper :: O.Map [c]
130      -- ^ __Map:__ Pick right-proper part from right contents
131      --
132      --   >>> pkRProper pk "BCDE"
133      --   "DE"
134
135    , pkRForward :: O.Map [c]
136      -- ^ __Map:__ Move shared terms forward.
137      --
138      --   >>> pkRForward pk "BCDE"
139      --   "BCDE"
140
141    , pkRBackward :: O.Map [c]
142      -- ^ __Map:__ Move shared terms backward.
143      --
144      --   >>> pkRBackward pk "BCDE"
145      --   "DEBC"
146
147    , pkRSplit :: [c] -> ([c], [c])
148      -- ^ __Split:__ Pick right-shared and right-proper part
149      --
150      --   >>> pkRSplit pk "BCDE"
151      --   ("BC", "DE")
152
153    , pkRAssoc :: [c] -> ([c], [c])
154      -- ^ __Split:__ Pick right-shared part and right contents
155      --
156      --   >>> pkRAssoc pk "BCDE"
157      --   ("BC", "BCDE")
158    }
159
